author: VinInn
body:
It is well known that about half of the propagation to a tracker sensor fails in particular in
TrajectorySegmentBuilder::redoMeasurements.
This is due to the geometrical topology of Strip sub-layers where only half of the surface is covered by sensors (even less in the endcap)
To mitigate the cost of these failed propagations we first use a straight-line approximation and use that to estimate compatibility with the given GeomDet if the "sagita" is below a given threshold.
The sagita threshold, as well as the minimal tolerance,  are configurable parameters of the MeasurementEstimator.
Parameters has be tuned to minimize efficiency losses... (a better tune is surely possible)

at PU35 for ttbar events we save 35% in GeomDetCompatibilityChecker::isCompatible itself while
TrajectorySegmentBuilder::redoMeasurements becomes a factor 2 faster.

I do expect some iterations to finalize the parameter setting (and fix misspelling)

p.s.
most of the changes are due to the migration of Chi2MeasurementEstimator to fillDescriptions...
title: Use straight-line propagation for "stiff" tracks  to check GeomDet compatibility
